<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-444872">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Moneycircus
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 27, 2021 7:29 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 27, 2021 7:29 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=NAZI Bargain And The Post-... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F27%2Fseizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1%2F%23comment-444872" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/#comment-444872"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p><a href="https://moneycircus.substack.com/p/nazi-bargain-and-the-post-war-order" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">NAZI Bargain And The Post-War Order – Did the WW2 settlement cloak plans to revive the fascist project?</a></p>
<p>Why did some NAZI enterprises get shut down and others survive, some tycoons face the Nuremberg dock and others not, and who decided which scientists to ship off to the United States and grant citizenship?</p>
<p>Take a step back and recognize that the NAZI project was a huge moneymaker. American companies like General Electric, IBM, Ford, DuPont and Rockefeller’s Standard Oil of New Jersey (the biggest sub-unit after its break-up) all traded with the enemy for most of the war. As it was ending, the Allies determined not to repeat the mistake of the Versailles Treaty and impose onerous reparations. They felt it was more important to rebuild Germany as a bulwark against the Soviet Union.</p>
<p>The planning may have gone further, however. Was there another motive for this continuity and did someone hope for the revival of the NAZI project or its continuation in another format? The evidence suggests that some did.</p>
<p>The plan for a United States of Europe dated from the interwar years, if not earlier, when French and German fascists dreamt of uniting the two countries.</p>
<p>The role of the CIA and its predecessor, the Office of Strategic Services (OSS), is also indisputable at this point. “All along, the CIA-run front group was funding the so-called European Movement,” as revealed by declassified government documents.</p>
<p>Europe was to be unified under a single regime, with the goal of a transatlantic union that would merge the United States with the European superstate. The same agenda resurfaced during the Obama administration in 2013 as the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership.</p>
<p>Despite Donald Trump supposedly torpedoing TTIP and the EU suffering Brexit, Britain continues to position itself as an Atlantic way station for the U.S. in a rebranded Trans-Pacific Partnership, adopting the governing “rules” on UK trade. This gives EU policy priority over supposed national policy on agriculture, fisheries, trade and the environment.</p>
<p>Britain is an Atlantic way station in defence, too. Not only did it in 2020 enter the European Defence Union but in 2021 created AUKUS (or AUS-UK-US) to defend “our shared interests.”</p>
<p>In 1899 Tsar Nicholas II organized an international peace conference, concerned as he was by the arms race unleashed by industrial mass production.</p>
<p>It would seem that an attempt to prevent WW1 was hijacked by U.S. tax-evading foundations with the aid of the Dutch Royal Family who were, and are, key players in the oil industry through their stake in Royal Dutch Shell and would later found the Bilderberg Group.</p>
<p>The one ruler who may have tried to stop WW1 was then removed and his family liquidated. His country was annexed for an experiment in social engineering. Then his plan for a world tribunal was repurposed first as the League of Nations and then the United Nations.</p>
<p>One common thread that you may notice is that the globalists are not imaginative. They repeatedly hijack and redirect the efforts of others, from the World Court to Greenpeace.</p>
<p><a href="https://moneycircus.substack.com/p/nazi-bargain-and-the-post-war-order" rel="nofollow ugc">https://moneycircus.substack.com/p/nazi-bargain-and-the-post-war-order</a></p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/#comment-444948"></i></span>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-444872">
Moneycircus
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>“The one ruler who may have tried to stop WW1”.</p>
<p>I assume you mean the Tsar – but there’s at least as good a case that Kaiser Wilhelm tried to stop WW1. He wanted Germany to mobilise only in the East only to be told by Von Moltke this was impossible. Von Moltke changed the mobilisation plans in the West anyway to ensure they would fail (they probably would have failed anyway but oligarchs didn’t get where they are today by taking chances). </p>
<p>It’s probably meaningless that Von Moltke happened to be a Theosophist like, for example, Montagu Norman, the head of the Bank of England. I’m sure he put his country first and didn’t deliberately lead Germany off a cliff so it would be no obstacle to a worldwide government.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Interesting post. Herr Schicklgruber could shed some light on these long laid plans.</p>
<p>Martin Bormann, another insiders insider, set up hundreds of shell companies to protect the finances of the Reich from 1943 on with help from the Bank for International Settlements. Arguably the first of the Globalists.</p>
<p>Who won WW ll is still an unanswered question for many, but with the appearance of a world at war with itself I do not think that we will need to wait much longer to find out.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>With regard to the possible continuation of the Nazi regime I would point to Mae Brussell. She made the Nazi connection frequently. Starting with JFK assassination.</p>
<p>Dan Sheehan tells a very interesting story toward the end of his 2012 lecture “Trajectory of Justice – 8 cases that changed the world” It took place as he was litigating the Iran Contra case. Nazi link.</p>
<p>I just realized that perhaps you have referred to both in your written link. I have not read it yet, but will now.</p>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=That Event Covid was purel... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F27%2Fseizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1%2F%23comment-444860" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/#comment-444860"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>That Event Covid was purely a means of facilitating changes which were prepared long in advance is the only thing that can explain those breathtakingly assured predictions about “the New Normal” which appeared the moment the virus itself was announced. The flaccid claim that the virus just happened and the rulers seized on it as an opportunity is not merely annulled by the swiftness of their “opportunism” but also completely neuters all opposition since such clearly assumes the virus is indeed deadly. Thus this spineless opposition can only say, “The bastards used the pandemic … but since the pandemic is real, there’s nothing we can do about it!”   </p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="Edwige" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1cd7687c46560cb04a7a78c9b9f4502c?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1cd7687c46560cb04a7a78c9b9f4502c?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-444856">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Edwige
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 27, 2021 6:42 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 27, 2021 6:42 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=People herded into smart c... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F27%2Fseizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1%2F%23comment-444856" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/#comment-444856"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>People herded into smart cities connected by rail is part of the plan. Well I never:</p>
<p><a href="https://dumptheguardian.com/commentisfree/2021/oct/27/why-we-need-a-new-golden-age-of-european-rail" rel="nofollow ugc">https://dumptheguardian.com/commentisfree/2021/oct/27/why-we-need-a-new-golden-age-of-european-rail</a></p>
<p>There’s a good example of weaponised opinion polling in this. Two-thirds of people support banning flights to places reachable by train in 12 hours? Really? </p>
<p>It’s curious how there’s a big push on for driverless cars but one never hears about driverless trains. Trains would seem more practical for driverless tech but it seems paying a few drivers to keep train travel attractive is a price worth paying (although I don’t doubt trains will become driverless eventually when the alternatives have been eliminated).</p>
<p>Anyone familiar with ‘The Hunger Games’ will recognise this as part of the world portrayed in that series.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like" title="0">0</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike" title="0">0</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Partly. The bit near where I live is still just a huge open-cast scar across the landscape. No guarantee that it’s ever going to be more than that. Certainly no guarantee that it will ever get beyond B’ham.</p>

<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=A big part of the joy of l... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F27%2Fseizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1%2F%23comment-444903" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/27/seizing-everything-the-theft-of-the-global-commons-part-1/#comment-444903"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-444856">
Edwige
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>A big part of the joy of long-distance train travel was that trains weren’t as fast as planes. You could open the windows and breathe. You could hang out of those windows (“<em>È pericoloso sporgersi</em>!”) and laugh with joy while smoking a fag and struggling to talk French or German with the girl you’d just met. You could go eight hours or more without making a phone call, or even wanting to. You could look at buildings and animals and people as they appeared and vanished forever. You could see the kids waving, and you could wave back. You could notice how places stayed the same and then gradually or suddenly became different. You had time to acquire a lasting memory of the sight of a magical place. You could feel what departures and arrivals meant. You could think about time, and about how it wasn’t money. </p>
<p>HS2 is for arseholes.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Ultimately for the birds; who will nest in the trees that will grow in the tracks and their cuttings and embankments, after the Long Descent away from industrial civilisation is complete – probably a couple of centuries from now…</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I think it’ll remain for a long time yet, just a for a much-restricted clientele. Hence the current cull. The world’s worst people intend to inherit the earth.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-444903">
Patrick L.
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>+1 for memory.</p>
<p>I have always hated flying, insisted on train. A couple of days fortified by fresh sourdough, brie, salami, wine and beer that I could carry on. Quietly partying as the expanse rolled past. It is IMO, the most civilized transport, I wish they’d stop trying to ruin it.</p>
</div>
